channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CT
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CT

item.title: Report X-2024070963
item.description:
Report X-2024070963

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SOUTH WINDSOR
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package is a case of four 1-gallon bottles decalcifier for histology use. Has loose caps, experienced compression/crushing, leaked. Caps not secured w/ tape or by other means. Liquids not bagged to prevent release. Relatively tall container unlikely to remain upright during transport and sort.

item.title: Report X-2024070960
item.description:
Report X-2024070960

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box has no marking on it. The box contains 2X1gal bottles of Equicare Flysect Super-7 Repellent spray. SDS shows it is a flammable liquid. The box is wet from the leaking bottle of flysect. 1 bottle has a crack down the seam and the other is soiled form leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024070261
item.description:
Report E-2024070261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: MERIDEN
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 3, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1755 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the dock floor and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Services, Inc. (ESI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 85-gallon drum. ESI utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted material was containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2024070594
item.description:
Report X-2024070594

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: WILLINGTON
  • State: CT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box is marked with a corrosive diamond. The box contains 4X1gal bottles of Ecolab Ecotemp Phase 1 Detergent. The top of the box is wet from the leaking 2X1gal bottles. 2 bottles had the caps a little loose and the seals under the caps are broken allowing them to leak. The other 2 are soiled from the leakage.
